list_definition.definition: a plant whose leaves are used as a herb and whose seeds are used as a spice in cooking; cilantro American

list_ex_of_english: The sauces are made of several ingredients including chili, onion, red and green tomatoes, and coriander.
It is possible to grow coriander for industrial purposes as well as other oilseed plants on set-aside land under the area arable payment scheme.
Green mojo usually includes coriander, parsley, and garlic; whilst red mojo is piquant, and made from a mix of hot and sweet peppers.
Skhug is made from fresh hot peppers seasoned with coriander, garlic and various spices.
Once reduced to powder or flakes, the peppers are often mixed with salt and roasted ground coriander seed.
Some of the most common metheglins are ginger, tea, orange peel, nutmeg, coriander, cinnamon, cloves or vanilla.
These results suggest that additional enzymes from coriander are likely required for its efficient production and accumulation in transgenic seeds.
A combination of coriander and tamarind chutneys are often used as garnishments in addition to those mentioned above.
